content: Compound 1 [Cs4(C8H3NO6)2·(H2O)7]n (1) was synthesized by adding 0.65 g (2 mmol) of cesium carbonate to a solution of 0.42 g (2 mmol) of 5-nitrobenzene-1,3-dicarboxylic acid (5-nitroisophthalic acid) in 50 mL of 50% aqueous ethanol. The mixture was heated for ca. 15 min at 90 °C and the resultant hot-filtered solution was allowed to partially evaporate at room temperature, giving after several weeks, large chemically stable prisms and plates of 1. A cleaved specimen was used for analysis using single-crystal X-ray diffraction, giving the structure reported here.
clean_text:
Experimental

Synthesis

Compound 1 [Cs4(C8H3NO6)2⋅(H2O)7]n (1) was synthesized by adding 0.65 g (2 mmol) of cesium carbonate to a solution of 0.42 g (2 mmol) of 5-nitrobenzene-1,3-dicarboxylic acid (5-nitroisophthalic acid) in 50 mL of 50% aqueous ethanol. The mixture was heated for ca. 15 min at 90 °C and the resultant hot-filtered solution was allowed to partially evaporate at room temperature, giving after several weeks, large chemically stable prisms and plates of 1. A cleaved specimen was used for analysis using single-crystal X-ray diffraction, giving the structure reported here.
